#SOUCHE On Pulisic's injury, Tuchel says he is not worried about it and there are just some little issues in the calf. He stopped training yesterday before it became an injury. It is more a case of risk management. 

#SOUCHE On what he has learned since taking over, Tuchel says he has seen an 'incredible work ethic from the players, who are hungry to improve and compete as a team'. He knows he can rely on them and has seen plenty of 'good signals' in our games.

#SOUCHE Tuchel says we will need to be brave enough to implement and impose our style in the coming weeks, irrespective of the opponent. The challenge tomorrow is to continue 'putting our intensity on the pitch', he adds. 

#SOUCHE Tuchel starts with an injury update, and it's good news on Tammy Abraham who is due to train today. Thiago Silva will be out for Southampton, and it is likely Christian Pulisic, who has some issues with his calf, will be too. Kai Havertz is fit again and available.

#SOUCHE Thomas Tuchel will face the media shortly.

#CHENEW Tuchel is sure Kai Havertz will come good: 'He is totally self-aware, very humble and super talented, and I am convinced he will have a big future at this club'.

Tuchel adds he hopes to see Havertz back training very soon.

#CHENEW Tuchel notes players like Hudson-Odoi can offer a threat from different parts of the pitch, giving us the possibility to react and be flexible. He adds the Academy is the backbone of any club and it was good to see three youngsters combine for the goal last night.

#CHENEW On the busy schedule, Tuchel recognises it would have been beneficial to have more time to work with his players on the training pitch, but he has 'got to know his team better' from matches and witnessed the spirit and mentality of his squad during tricky times. 

#CHENEW Tuchel says he will focus on the details from last night's game and won't be too critical of his players. His job is to help them understand what they can do better ahead of what he expects to be a tough challenge from Newcastle.

#CHENEW Tuchel starts with the latest team news. He confirms Christensen didn't suffer any sort of concussion last night, just a headache. Werner should be 'absolutely okay' to come back, but the game will be too soon for Thiago Silva and probably Havertz, too.

#CHENEW At 11am, Thomas Tuchel will be previewing #CHENEW!

#TOTCHE Kurt Zouma and Kai Havertz are doubts for the Spurs game after picking up injuries in training today: 'They came off the pitch with little issues which we are checking now. It's questionable if they will be in the squad for tomorrow.'

#TOTCHE Tuchel says it is important for him to retain an Academy identity in his squad and praises the technical and physical attributes the young players possess. 'We rely on them and trust them so they will be given every chance to make their steps,' he adds.

#TOTCHE On being aware of Spurs as a kid, Tuchel admits he and his friends knew of them but he insists 'there is no doubt I go there tomorrow in blue and we do everything to win the game.' He says he doesn't drink a lot of alcohol but will have a gin and tonic if we win!

#TOTCHE Tuchel believes Mason Mount's dedication and positive energy will help him grow into a top player: 'When you train and play with him, you are sure he gives 100% all the time. He has everything needed to reach even higher levels.'

#TOTCHE Tuchel says he and his staff are working to develop bonds with each individual player in the squad to find the best conditions for them to succeed. On Werner, he believes the team need to create situations for him to attack the space in behind and utilise his speed.

#TOTCHE Tuchel starts by assessing the challenge of taking on Tottenham in his first away game as Chelsea boss, stating it will be a tough test against 'a strong and competitive squad' put together by Jose Mourinho.

There will be plenty more from a fascinating press conference on our website and the 5th Stand app soon. Thanks for following. 

#WelcomeTuchel On Billy Gilmour, Tuchel says he is a 'strategic guy with a high level of understanding, and super quick with his feet and decision making'. He sees no reason for anyone in the squad to leave this month. 

#WelcomeTuchel Tuchel says he likes what he sees from Mount so far: 'His personality is amazing and he is such a competitive guy. He leaves his heart on the pitch and he cares for Chelsea 100 per cent. This is the best basis for big development.'

#WelcomeTuchel On Kante's best position, Tuchel thinks it is in a 'double six' in the middle of the pitch where we can use his energy and his range of attributes. 

#WelcomeTuchel Tuchel believes the Premier League brings the best out of coaches and players, and he expects it to do the same for him as he pits his wits against the best managers in the world.

#WelcomeTuchel Tuchel says it is a 'big, big challenge' to take over a team in the middle of the season, especially this one. He says we will miss the supporters in the stadium, and also because of social distancing rules at Cobham it is harder to create a bond between everyone.

#WelcomeTuchel Tuchel: 'People should be excited to come to Stamford Bridge and watch our team, and see a team playing with a special kind of energy and atmosphere, but at Chelsea we play for trophies and titles, we don't hide from that.'

#WelcomeTuchel Tuchel says he is happy with the squad size and adds Kante returned to training today so he has 22 outfield players to pick from. He thinks that is a good number considering our busy schedule and the fact we are in three different competitions. 

#WelcomeTuchel Tuchel hopes the Chelsea supporters will get behind him, and he completely understands why some will be disappointed Frank Lampard left. Tuchel reveals he received a message from Lampard today wishing him luck: 'I have the biggest respect for him and his legacy.'

#WelcomeTuchel Tuchel starts by saying he 'absolutely couldn't miss the chance to join one of the biggest clubs in the world' and it was an 'easy choice'. He says he has big ambitions and his first days have been 'amazing'.

That's all for now. More on our website and app shortly.

#CHELUT Frank says he is grateful for the effort of fans who have expressed support for him with a new banner at Stamford Bridge. 'Everyone who knows me knows how I feel about this club so I absolutely appreciate that,' he adds.

#CHELUT Lampard emphasises that the Premier League is the most physical and fastest league in the world so it's natural that new players take time to adapt, particularly when they're young. He believes it is a process that always requires time.

#CHELUT On Fikayo Tomori, Lampard says there is no confirmation on any loan deal yet and he remains in the same situation.

#CHELUT Frank reiterates he is only focused on what's in front of him and the team, rather than any speculation: 'I don't listen to it. I'm not stupid because I know the pressure with managing in a top job but the talk doesn't matter to me.'

#CHELUT Lampard starts by saying the focus is on Sunday's game against Luton Town: 'We lost our last game, we won the one before that and we want to every game. I'll pick a team to try to get through to the next round.'

#CHELUT The boss will be speaking to the media ahead of #CHELUT from 1pm (UK) today! 🎙

#LEICHE On Brendan Rodgers, Lampard describes him as a gentleman and a good friend, and he says it was clear he was going to be a successful manager when he was at Chelsea. He adds that his sides are hard to go up against. 
#LEICHE Lampard says a good result at Leicester will help with confidence as they are a good team, but he says work ethic is just as important as confidence at the moment, as the quality in the squad is there. 
#LEICHE Lampard calls Mason Mount an example for other players as he is someone who is always fighting to be at his best.
#LEICHE On Fikayo Tomori, Lampard explains he is a developing player and his lack of playing time this season is due to having five centre-backs in the squad, which is why Tomori may go out on loan.
#LEICHE Frank Lampard says that N'Golo Kante is not ready for the squad for tomorrow's game at Leicester. He has not recovered from his hamstring strain sufficiently. He reports no other injuries. 
#LEICHE At 1.30pm (UK) today... 🎙 Danny Drinkwater will go out on loan for the remainder of this season.

#FULCHE https://t.co/Y5vdIoVjMx A bit of inside goss from @MasonMount_10! 👀😬 📅 Our #FACup fourth round tie against Luton Town will kick-off at 12pm (UK) on Sunday 24 January. https://t.co/YyEqArNhaP You can still get your votes in for Thiago and Kova! 🗳👌

@EASPORTSFIFA #TOTY Frank at the Cottage! 🚀 #TBT https://t.co/xz1ozqKwEh Finally, Lampard emphasises that Fikayo Tomori 'absolutely has a long-term future at this club,' whether or not he goes on loan this month. 'I have a long-term plan for him,' he adds.

That's all from the boss for now. There will be more on our website and app shortly.

#FULCHE On Timo Werner, Lampard says it is normal for him and others to take time to get used to new ideas, such as pressing from the front. He adds that recent time in training has helped with this and expects his performances to get even better playing as the main striker.

#FULCHE Frank recalls Scott Parker's 'diligence, good football brain, determination and preparation' as a player, suggesting those attributes always made him feel his former team-mate could go into coaching if he wanted to.

#FULCHE Lampard believes he and his players are doing their best to follow Covid protocols during this difficult time: 'There are meetings planned to reinforce that. Football has always been a game of instinct and that's not easy to take away but we're trying to adapt.'

#FULCHE Frank says he always feels pressure managing a club like Chelsea, during positive periods as well as tougher runs: 'It focuses the mind. The pressure has always been there even during our good run.'

#FULCHE On the upcoming derby against Fulham, Lampard says it is an exciting fixture and one he has always felt has an extra edge to it. He notes that, while different from some other derbies, Fulham always want to beat us.

#FULCHE Lampard starts with a positive update on the fitness of his squad: 'We're all good. N'Golo Kante is suspended but back training with us from tomorrow.'

#FULCHE Good luck, Lucas! 👊 Coming up at 1.30pm today... 🎙

'They have real potential for us,' he adds.

That's all from the boss - more on our website and app later today.

#CHEMOR Reflecting on recent pressure, Lampard explains that he always expected it: 'I came into this job expecting pressure. I never expected an easy run, coming to a big club in the process of a rebuild. That was never going to be easy.'

#CHEMOR Frank: 'The FA Cup has a magic that's been there forever, which means underdogs will turn up and cause you problems. If we play well and do our job, I believe we will win but we have to respect Morecambe.'

#CHEMOR Lampard reiterates there are concerns because of the current climate of the pandemic but none of his players have tested positive in recent testing. He praises the club's medical staff for going above and beyond to help keep everyone safe.

#CHEMOR On Kepa, Frank says the goalkeeper has been training well and continues to show a positive attitude around the place. 'He's been brilliant and he's our player,' he adds.

#CHEMOR Lampard will not be drawn on his starting line-up for the Cup tie but reveals a number of young players have been training with the group due to changes in the Covid bubble rules, which is a big plus, and some may be involved against Morecambe.

#CHEMOR The boss starts with an update on those that might be involved on Sunday and says Reece James, Andreas Christensen and N'Golo Kante are all out: 'Reece will train with us tomorrow but this game is too soon. N'Golo has a minor hamstring injury.'

#CHEMOR Frank Lampard will be speaking to the press ahead of #CHEMOR at 1:30pm (UK) today.

#CHEWHU Lampard has words of praise for Declan Rice for the good start he has made to his career for West Ham and England. He says there shouldn't be regret for our Academy because they are one of the best in the world and have brought through so many wonderful talents of late.

#CHEWHU On West Ham, Lampard acknowledges the good work done by David Moyes this season and says they are well coached in many different areas. He says as a player the fixture meant more to him, but now as a manager it is just another game.

#CHEWHU Lampard says it would have been really beneficial for player welfare if five subs had been approved, but he recognises the decision has been made and we must carry on as we were.

#CHEWHU The boss starts with an injury update, and reports Ziyech and Hudson-Odoi are back training with the team for the first time today. He will have to see where they're at on Monday before he makes a decision for West Ham. That is the only injury news.

#CHENEW

Tuchel is sure Kai Havertz will come good: 'He is totally self-aware, very humble and super talented, and I am convinced he will have a big future at this club'.

Tuchel adds he hopes to see Havertz back training very soon.

#CHENEW

Tuchel notes players like Hudson-Odoi can offer a threat from different parts of the pitch, giving us the possibility to react and be flexible. He adds the Academy is the backbone of any club and it was good to see three youngsters combine for the goal last night.

#CHENEW

On the busy schedule, Tuchel recognises it would have been beneficial to have more time to work with his players on the training pitch, but he has 'got to know his team better' from matches and witnessed the spirit and mentality of his squad during tricky times. 

#CHENEW

Tuchel says he will focus on the details from last night's game and won't be too critical of his players. His job is to help them understand what they can do better ahead of what he expects to be a tough challenge from Newcastle.

#CHENEW

Tuchel starts with the latest team news. He confirms Christensen didn't suffer any sort of concussion last night, just a headache. Werner should be 'absolutely okay' to come back, but the game will be too soon for Thiago Silva and probably Havertz, too.

#CHENEW

Finally, responding to the recent racist abuse received by Reece James online, Tuchel insists the player has received total support from him and the club. 'I'm 1000% on his side,' he adds.

That's all from Tuchel for now. There'll be more on our website and app shortly.

#TOTCHE

Kurt Zouma and Kai Havertz are doubts for the Spurs game after picking up injuries in training today: 'They came off the pitch with little issues which we are checking now. It's questionable if they will be in the squad for tomorrow.'

#TOTCHE

Tuchel says it is important for him to retain an Academy identity in his squad and praises the technical and physical attributes the young players possess. 'We rely on them and trust them so they will be given every chance to make their steps,' he adds.

#TOTCHE

On being aware of Spurs as a kid, Tuchel admits he and his friends knew of them but he insists 'there is no doubt I go there tomorrow in blue and we do everything to win the game.' He says he doesn't drink a lot of alcohol but will have a gin and tonic if we win!

#TOTCHE

Tuchel believes Mason Mount's dedication and positive energy will help him grow into a top player: 'When you train and play with him, you are sure he gives 100% all the time. He has everything needed to reach even higher levels.'

#TOTCHE

Tuchel says he and his staff are working to develop bonds with each individual player in the squad to find the best conditions for them to succeed. On Werner, he believes the team need to create situations for him to attack the space in behind and utilise his speed.

#TOTCHE

Tuchel starts by assessing the challenge of taking on Tottenham in his first away game as Chelsea boss, stating it will be a tough test against 'a strong and competitive squad' put together by Jose Mourinho.

#TOTCHE

That's all from Thomas Tuchel's first media conference at Cobham. There will be plenty more from a fascinating press conference on our website and the 5th Stand app soon. Thanks for following. 

#WelcomeTuchel

On Billy Gilmour, Tuchel says he is a 'strategic guy with a high level of understanding, and super quick with his feet and decision making'. He sees no reason for anyone in the squad to leave this month. 

#WelcomeTuchel

Tuchel says he likes what he sees from Mount so far: 'His personality is amazing and he is such a competitive guy. He leaves his heart on the pitch and he cares for Chelsea 100 per cent. This is the best basis for big development.'

#WelcomeTuchel

On Kante's best position, Tuchel thinks it is in a 'double six' in the middle of the pitch where we can use his energy and his range of attributes. 

#WelcomeTuchel

Tuchel believes the Premier League brings the best out of coaches and players, and he expects it to do the same for him as he pits his wits against the best managers in the world.

#WelcomeTuchel

Tuchel says it is a 'big, big challenge' to take over a team in the middle of the season, especially this one. He says we will miss the supporters in the stadium, and also because of social distancing rules at Cobham it is harder to create a bond between everyone.

#WelcomeTuchel

Tuchel: 'People should be excited to come to Stamford Bridge and watch our team, and see a team playing with a special kind of energy and atmosphere, but at Chelsea we play for trophies and titles, we don't hide from that.'

#WelcomeTuchel

Tuchel says he is happy with the squad size and adds Kante returned to training today so he has 22 outfield players to pick from. He thinks that is a good number considering our busy schedule and the fact we are in three different competitions. 

#WelcomeTuchel

Tuchel hopes the Chelsea supporters will get behind him, and he completely understands why some will be disappointed Frank Lampard left. Tuchel reveals he received a message from Lampard today wishing him luck: 'I have the biggest respect for him and his legacy.'

#WelcomeTuchel

Tuchel starts by saying he 'absolutely couldn't miss the chance to join one of the biggest clubs in the world' and it was an 'easy choice'. He says he has big ambitions and his first days have been 'amazing'. 

#WelcomeTuchel

Finally, Lampard says the players have to direct the pressure of recent form in the right way on the pitch. He acknowledges the buy-in of the dressing room will always be the most important thing for a manager.

That's all for now. More on our website and app shortly.

#CHELUT

Frank says he is grateful for the effort of fans who have expressed support for him with a new banner at Stamford Bridge. 'Everyone who knows me knows how I feel about this club so I absolutely appreciate that,' he adds.

#CHELUT

Lampard emphasises that the Premier League is the most physical and fastest league in the world so it's natural that new players take time to adapt, particularly when they're young. He believes it is a process that always requires time.

#CHELUT

On Fikayo Tomori, Lampard says there is no confirmation on any loan deal yet and he remains in the same situation.

#CHELUT

Frank reiterates he is only focused on what's in front of him and the team, rather than any speculation: 'I don't listen to it. I'm not stupid because I know the pressure with managing in a top job but the talk doesn't matter to me.'

#CHELUT

Lampard starts by saying the focus is on Sunday's game against Luton Town: 'We lost our last game, we won the one before that and we want to every game. I'll pick a team to try to get through to the next round.'

#CHELUT

Finally, Lampard emphasises that Fikayo Tomori 'absolutely has a long-term future at this club,' whether or not he goes on loan this month. 'I have a long-term plan for him,' he adds.

That's all from the boss for now. There will be more on our website and app shortly.

#FULCHE

On Timo Werner, Lampard says it is normal for him and others to take time to get used to new ideas, such as pressing from the front. He adds that recent time in training has helped with this and expects his performances to get even better playing as the main striker.

#FULCHE

Frank recalls Scott Parker's 'diligence, good football brain, determination and preparation' as a player, suggesting those attributes always made him feel his former team-mate could go into coaching if he wanted to.

#FULCHE

Lampard believes he and his players are doing their best to follow Covid protocols during this difficult time: 'There are meetings planned to reinforce that. Football has always been a game of instinct and that's not easy to take away but we're trying to adapt.'

#FULCHE

Frank says he always feels pressure managing a club like Chelsea, during positive periods as well as tougher runs: 'It focuses the mind. The pressure has always been there even during our good run.'

#FULCHE

On the upcoming derby against Fulham, Lampard says it is an exciting fixture and one he has always felt has an extra edge to it. He notes that, while different from some other derbies, Fulham always want to beat us.

#FULCHE

Lampard starts with a positive update on the fitness of his squad: 'We're all good. N'Golo Kante is suspended but back training with us from tomorrow.'

#FULCHE

Finally, Frank explains how the young players training with the group have helped everyone as it keeps intensity high and allows them to develop further. 'They have real potential for us,' he adds.

That's all from the boss - more on our website and app later today.

#CHEMOR

Reflecting on recent pressure, Lampard explains that he always expected it: 'I came into this job expecting pressure. I never expected an easy run, coming to a big club in the process of a rebuild. That was never going to be easy.'

#CHEMOR

Frank: 'The FA Cup has a magic that's been there forever, which means underdogs will turn up and cause you problems. If we play well and do our job, I believe we will win but we have to respect Morecambe.'

#CHEMOR

Lampard reiterates there are concerns because of the current climate of the pandemic but none of his players have tested positive in recent testing. He praises the club's medical staff for going above and beyond to help keep everyone safe.

#CHEMOR

On Kepa, Frank says the goalkeeper has been training well and continues to show a positive attitude around the place. 'He's been brilliant and he's our player,' he adds.

#CHEMOR

Lampard will not be drawn on his starting line-up for the Cup tie but reveals a number of young players have been training with the group due to changes in the Covid bubble rules, which is a big plus, and some may be involved against Morecambe.

#CHEMOR

The boss starts with an update on those that might be involved on Sunday and says Reece James, Andreas Christensen and N'Golo Kante are all out: 'Reece will train with us tomorrow but this game is too soon. N'Golo has a minor hamstring injury.'

#CHEMOR

Frank Lampard will be speaking to the press ahead of #CHEMOR at 1:30pm (UK) today.

#ICYMI Team news updates for City as Lampard confirms defender set to miss out 👇

Lampard says he isn't absolutely sure what the January transfer window holds for us. He notes we have a big squad so we will see, but his focus remains on the players at his disposal and working to get the best out of them. 

That's all from the boss for now.

#CHEMCI

Lampard is confident in our team and knows we can beat anybody at the Bridge. He says we will have to be at our best to win because of the strength of opposition. He doesn't see any weaknesses in the Man City side, but he knows if we are at our best we can create some.

#CHEMCI

Lampard reiterates safety and security have to be paramount in these tough times. He believes the Premier League and clubs have done everything to make the environment as safe as possible, but that can't always be enough, so if football has to stop, it has to stop. 

#CHEMCI

Lampard says Hakim Ziyech has trained the past two or three days but no decision has yet been made on whether he will start on Sunday. Reece James is out of the game with a hamstring problem. 

#CHEMCI

The boss says at the moment Sunday's game is on. He says there have been a couple of positive cases in the Chelsea camp although not in the playing staff. 

#CHEMCI

Lampard confirms that Hakim Ziyech will not be fit for the Arsenal game. He hopes to have him back in the next week or so. That is all the news from the boss here for now. 
#ARSCHE

Returning to the subject of Werner, Lampard says the player's honesty in what he has said about his form is a good thing, even if it gets taken in the wrong context. 
#ARSCHE

Lampard recalls that when he joined Chelsea as a player, Arsenal had the upper hand but the team he played in challenged that and a good rivalry remains. 
#ARSCHE

On being in charge at a big club, Lampard explains that expectations are high but you can't control that, so you must work day to day and bring genuine positivity. 
#ARSCHE

Lampard says when you play a derby match, form goes out the window and he is expecting Arsenal to be at their best on Boxing Day, which is a good attacking team. 
#ARSCHE

On Timo Werner being on a run of not scoring, Lampard says the goals will come as he is getting in the places to have chances. 
#ARSCHE

Frank Lampard reports Ben Chilwell and Reece James are both doubtful for the next two games.

Lampard is not worried about Timo Werner's form: 'He is getting into positions regularly, scaring teams and causing problems. It's not quite going for him at the moment but he will start scoring soon.'

#CHEWHU

Lampard says Cesar Azpilicueta came in and did really well tonight, especially from a defensive point of view which was crucial. The boss adds he hopes Reece James' injury is not too bad and he can still be involved in this busy Christmas period. 

#CHEWHU

Lampard expects Ben Chilwell to be a doubt for Arsenal after he turned his ankle early on. He will be scanned tomorrow to check out the severity of the injury. 

#CHEWHU

Lampard says that was just the result we needed after a couple of defeats. He says our performance was really good, especially our defensive game against a threatening West Ham side who are playing well at the moment.

Frank says it is his decision when to switch wingers during a game, and he believes Werner and Pulisic are both adept at playing on either flank. 

That's all from Lampard for now, there will be more online and on the app shortly. Thanks for following. 

#CHEWHU

Lampard has words of praise for Declan Rice for the good start he has made to his career for West Ham and England. He says there shouldn't be regret for our Academy because they are one of the best in the world and have brought through so many wonderful talents of late.

#CHEWHU

On West Ham, Lampard acknowledges the good work done by David Moyes this season and says they are well coached in many different areas. He says as a player the fixture meant more to him, but now as a manager it is just another game.

#CHEWHU

Lampard says it would have been really beneficial for player welfare if five subs had been approved, but he recognises the decision has been made and we must carry on as we were.

#CHEWHU

The boss starts with an injury update, and reports Ziyech and Hudson-Odoi are back training with the team for the first time today. He will have to see where they're at on Monday before he makes a decision for West Ham. That is the only injury news.

#CHEWHU
